Roy McBride.Action: Speaks slowly, formally, deliberately; seems guarded but sincere and precise; not overtly cruel or petty; intentions and integrity unquestionable.
Smiles all the time and his face often lights up with little motivation; makes occasional awkward jokes mostly for self-amusement.
Described as even-tempered but with an icy quality; not kind but not morose.
Described as even-tempered, precise, competent, sincere, and guarded; speaks slowly and deliberately to avoid repetition.
Smiles often and makes awkward jokes mostly for self-amusement, showing controlled emotional expression.
Not overtly kind but not cruel or petty; integrity and intentions are unquestioned.
Expresses admiration for his team and emphasizes mutual support: 'So we all feed on each other in that way.'
Speaks respectfully and appreciatively about his father despite differences, showing acceptance and forward-looking attitude.
Prefers to be left alone to perform duties, avoids spotlight and vulnerability.
Flashes a smile during the interview, indicating some friendliness despite reserved nature.
Dismisses larger, more philosophical questions about his mission, showing emotional distance or detachment.
Expresses desire to perform his duties well and maintain control away from the spotlight, showing focus and professionalism.
Acknowledges the importance of teamwork and being inspired by skilled colleagues, indicating awareness of collaborative competence.
Avoids engaging in speculative or philosophical discussion about the larger meaning of his work, focusing instead on practical duties.
Waves and gives a thumbs up to a smiling woman cheering him on.
Walks in a spacesuit, seemingly in his own world, not engaging much with the crowd around him.
Navigates a cramped, high-tech environment confidently, interacts positively with others while maintaining focus on his task.
Acknowledges the end of a certain phase or technology with a calm, matter-of-fact attitude.
Performs a playful golf ball trick behind Sal's ear, causing Sal to smile and nod in recognition; Roy grins widely in response.
Performs a lighthearted, skillful trick by pulling a golf ball from behind Sal's ear, showing confidence and ease in social interaction.
Calmly steps out into a hostile, high-altitude environment and begins to climb down a ladder, demonstrating physical capability and composure in a dangerous situation.
Communicates clearly and calmly with Control, reports unusual power surges with concern.
Insists on completing his tasks despite advice to abort, showing determination but potentially disregarding others' concerns.
Establishes visual contact with tether and confirms status with control calmly and clearly.
Rappels down a several-mile-long tether gracefully and performs technical task of closing the loop.
Notices and reports unusual power surges promptly to control.
Insists on continuing task despite control's advice to abort due to power surges.
Remains calm and communicates clearly during a dangerous, spinning out-of-control situation.
Focuses on completing his tasks despite personal danger, does not panic or call for help beyond necessary communication.
Pushes himself away from the activating tether at the last second, avoiding immediate danger.
Remains calm and communicates clearly over radio despite spinning uncontrollably.
Successfully stops his spin by stretching out limbs in denser air, demonstrating control and skill.
Pulls the ripcord to deploy parachute and safely lands, showing presence of mind and preparedness.
Expresses sympathy upon hearing about the loss of his support crew and others on Earth.
Politely declines to close the shades, showing interest in the natural world outside.
Responds respectfully and cooperatively to medical advice and instructions.
Accurately assesses his own physical condition (identifies left shoulder soreness as likely hyperextension).
Expresses polite but somewhat detached sympathy for lost crew members, indicating emotional restraint but awareness.
Chooses to keep the window shades open to observe cloud patterns and mountains, showing calmness and situational awareness.
Acknowledges medical advice and expresses desire to return to work promptly, demonstrating responsibility and commitment.
Has trouble maintaining eye contact with medical officers, which may suggest discomfort or social difficulty.
Responds calmly and reassuringly to his mother's emotional distress, smiles, and tries to ease her worry.
Prefers to be alone and downplays his mother's concern, showing emotional distance.
Calmly reassures his worried mother and maintains composure during an emotional video call.
Prefers solitude and accepts being alone, indicating self-reliance and emotional control.
Shuts off the video call decisively after the conversation ends.
Appears restless and wakes up sweating from a vision, showing possible internal struggle or distraction.
Responds politely and cooperatively to the young woman escorting him, saying 'Course, Ma’am.'
Calmly responds to the young woman escorting him to SPACECOM Control with 'Course, Ma’am.'
Experiences a panic episode with labored breathing and darting eyes after a disturbing vision.
Responds to young woman in army fatigues with a friendly smile and polite refusal.

Politely declines food and drink, showing self-control and focus.
Salutes and greets multiple superiors with appropriate military decorum.

Responds to praise with subtle pride but deflects personal credit, attributing success to training.
Maintains calm and controlled demeanor, showing no emotional reaction to stressful questions.
Performs exceptionally well on assessment tests, demonstrating near-photographic memory and exceptional basic combat and space training skills.
Maintains a calm pulse below 80 during stressful situations like spacewalks and falls, showing control and training.
Responds to praise with subtle pride but deflects personal credit, showing confidence without arrogance.
Expresses surprise at the nature of the debriefing but remains composed and unflustered.

Freezes slightly when asked about the Lima Project, indicating discomfort or guardedness.

Lets out a small, awkward laugh when discussing his mother's devastation, which may suggest discomfort or emotional vulnerability in a professional setting.

Initially hesitant and trying to understand before committing, showing thoughtfulness.

Scans and processes the lunar surface maps attentively during the shuttle ride.

Overcomes shyness to give a meaningful drawing to Francesca, showing emotional awareness and social skill.
Allows himself to be emotionally vulnerable by accepting a tender hug, indicating emotional intelligence and confidence.
Approaches and opens the electronic sarcophagus containing his father’s body, carefully removing life support equipment, demonstrating calmness and technical skill in a difficult situation.
Grabs his father’s spinning, lifeless body in an embrace before releasing it into space toward Neptune.
Formally reports the Lima Project status and recovered materials to SpaceCom with professionalism and responsibility.
Carefully retrieves and manages his father's lifeless body in weightlessness, preventing it from drifting away.
Successfully operates and brings online an unfamiliar 3-D printed spacecraft, restoring its systems and communication.
Calmly initiates radio communication with SpaceCom, confidently reporting the situation and his actions.
Records a heartfelt voice message to his mother, acknowledging her care and expressing concern for her feelings in case he does not return.
Flips off the radio abruptly after finishing communication, showing a reserved and somewhat detached demeanor.
Recovers significant material from the Lima Project after all crew are deceased and forwards it for analysis.
Identifies malfunctioning self-replicators and decides to destroy them to prevent further catastrophe.
Inputs precise target coordinates and plans a return journey to Earth, demonstrating careful navigation and planning.
Follows a printed checklist and adjusts several switches before takeoff, showing methodical preparation.
Activates gyroscopes and control stick, prepares oxygen mask, and settles into cockpit seat confidently.
Records a personal voice message revealing emotional vulnerability and hesitation.
Expresses gratitude to his mother for nurturing friendships and relationships, recalls pleasant memories, and acknowledges his emotional regrets sincerely.
Admits to being unable to protect his sister and regrets negative feelings toward his father, showing vulnerability and remorse.
States that forced solitude is now unacceptable, indicating a desire for connection and openness.
Acknowledges his emotional struggles but remains focused and completes his mission successfully.
Expresses regret for past failures to protect others and admits to committing questionable acts out of necessity.
Maintains control and composure while piloting the 3-D printed craft through intense rocket staging and powerful forces.
Successfully navigates the craft away from the devastating Lima Project site and initiates reentry toward Earth.
Responds appropriately to SpaceCom communication, confirming coordinates and preparing for debriefing.
